oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-11-23 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 23, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer - although Faron Young was advertised as the host for this week on the previous show), guest performer Benny Martin, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, the Jordanaires, Tommy Vaden, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 946th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Rod Brasfield; Benny Martin; Jordanaires; Tommy Vaden
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- The Rhumba Boogie (Hank Snow) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Benny Martin -- I Saw Your Face In The Moon (Benny Martin, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Tommy Vaden -- Old Joe Clark (Tommy Vaden fiddle) -- Hank Snow talks -- The Last Mile Of The Way (Hank Snow, Jordanaires)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Vaden, Tommy; Snow, Hank; Martin, Benny
